title: Stupid interaction between Taric's E and stealthed champions
body:
So... I just played vs a Twitch Taric botlane. 
Apparently, Taric's E is longer than Twitch's reveal range, and while Twitch is stealthed the dazzle ray is **invisible**.
Why? I mean, I've got stunned and I didn't even know why until Twitch came out of nowhere and melted me.

I don't know if this works with other champions too, but it makes no sense that I get stunned by something that I don't even get to see before dying.

replies.body: I think it's a problem with twitch in general. They need to increase his detection range or something.
Gl waiting for Twitch changes, been waiting for a season and nothing happened lol
quite sure twitch ll be getting championship skin
You're late, Ashe already got it. :^)
Pretty sure he meant victorious, and if that does happen, I will immediately play twitch in custom game with that skin and proceed to just run it down typing "SEWER SKEWERS FOR EVERYBODY!!!"
We had Sivir 2 years ago, it's unlikely that we'll get another adc.
Or they should make the particle visible no matter what?
Would make trolls pick taric if a teamate picks a stealth champ

Except trolls have better ways to troll.

You don't need to make this change for people to troll. They will find a way no matter what. If someone is intending to troll, this is a shitty way to do so.

if i want to troll ill just pick {{champion:223}} or {{champion:12}} 

they much better at it
What about from brush or fog of war?
Keep it the same as it is rn.
The sad thing is twitch detection range is smaller then Rengar detection range and one of them is a ult and the other a basic ability. Find the error.
That's an intended interaction. You can't see it out of a brush either

I understand for a brush, since facechecking is YOUR fault.

But with stealthed champions? I mean, what should I do to prevent him from stunning me with... 0 counterplay?

If he's dominant in the lane I don't have a solution for you. But what I do when laning against one is put a control ward in the brush so he can't ever sneak in.
Obviously this only works if he's not able to just fight you off of it and kill it, but if you do it early enough you'll be able to stop him from getting to that point.
yea, control ward or lense trinket. also firing skillshots makes invisible champs shine a bit.
I miss pink wards :(
Control wards.
Control wards doenst counter the stealth like the pink did.

So? 
The intend is utter bullshit. 
Same goes for orianna and shaco/twitch.
I believe it also works with Shen Ult on Twitch
Fun fact it also works with Shen ult on Kayn.  If kayn is ulting someone and shen ults him there's no warning that shen is coming in.
And Orianna ball.
submarine combo Rengar Shen ope ope

It's one of the oldest interactions. Before the stealth changes I did that with Ori+Twitch and the invisible ball. Just run in, drop the ult and then ult from the back line to turn enemies into cheddar. Ori is the biggest offender of this but others get this too.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UJXKUXax17U

this vids 3 years old and features stealth cheese.

heck iirc there used to be a strat involving evelynn and sunfire cape.

and even in the competitive scene, I remember, one of the biggest tactics in the LCS was the "rengar Orianna ball delivery service"

You do know that the Eve/twitch sunfire cape was patched really quick? Because it allowed you to kill people without even getting out of stealth.
I see the same thing here,you can potentially stun someone without even getting of stealth. And all that it implies.
I wonder if these champions should get their mana and cooldowns refunded for spells like that cast on allied champs that go invisible?
Would be too much of a gimmick.

I am a little salty people are saying its a twitch problem. Like it works for every stealth champion in the game. With the exception of very long detection ranges like Rengar.

This is a poor INVIS reaction =/= Twitch reaction.
Same thing with Ori ball on an invis champ it's hidden so they can run it up to you and Ori ults where you can't even see it
The stealth rework tried to improve counterplay but it didn't address everything. Would be nice if they could think of something to balance it without creating unfair situations.

I don't think the rework to stealth was trying to improve counterplay. That's what the addition of camouflage is for. Yes I know that didn't really improve much. Shaco has a long ass invisibility now, Akali has a longer and more situational one, and Vayne (though definitely not an assassin) can become invisible frequently. Riot removed the ability for pinks to counterplay invisibility, now they are only somewhat effective against camouflage. I don't think that this wouldn't have happened if Riot was trying to improve counterplay to stealth

When Riot was reworking the assassins, I believe they were going for more power in mobility and less or slower upfront burst. The stealth rework accomplished the first part and the balance changes to the assassins accomplished the second part and while doing so increased counterplay to the assassins themselves but not their stealths

Isn't "counterplay" the reason for those changes? Or at least for camouflage.

I think that the stealth rework tried to make invisibility one of a champion's main strength, even though they didn't even consider that invisibility is cancerous and should have not existed in the first place. Some examples are Akali or pre-nerfs Shaco that are a pain in the ass because you can only see their silhouette with sweeping lens.
Stealth has always been like that. No range indicators if the champion is out of vision. Sion can charge a knock-up in a bush, and nobody will know about it until they get popped up and stunned.
It's been like that since Tarics rework. You need good teamwork for it to really be effective though.
This has actually been a feature for a while now.  I think it is related to the whole nunu ult in a bush that can't be seen type thing.
It's the same if Taric is in a bush, and cast's his E. If you can't see a champion, you can't see their spells winding up. That's how it works for pretty much every champ in the game.
Fyi you're talking about camouflauge, not stealth.

Stealth is a generic word. Then we have camouflage, and invisibility. 

And still, my point was right even if we were talking about invisibility.

>
> Stealth is a generic word. Then we have camouflage, and invisibility. 
> 
> And still, my point was right even if we were talking about invisibility.

You talked about the reveal range, which only matters for camouflage. This interaction has been around forever, and in [far stupider forms](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UJXKUXax17U).

That said, past BS doesn't justify present BS. I intentionally did not comment on the body of your post since I had little to add that my upvote didn't already express.
Why would anything with Twitch be fair? It's not like we gutted {{champion:107}} for doing the same thing he does but to one person in melee range
Same thing works w/ Ori's ball, and Lulu's E and it works with other stealth champs too.

> I don't know if this works with other champions too, but it makes no sense that I get stunned by something that I don't even get to see before dying.

If I remember correctly it does, if a Shen ults on an Evelynn his teleport is invisible and all the enemy will see is shen just appear out of nowhere.

This was a neat trick I picked up on a few patches after Taric's Rework. It's an interaction that's super strong (surprised they never picked up on this), but I think it works best in coordinated teams where they have communications. Only thing I can think of is watching Taric {{champion:44}}  to see if he's going to use Dazzle. If he goes & looks like he's dazzling thin air, either run like the plague or pray your support has peel.
ooo I didnt know it worked like that :O!! I'm going to use that now :D
I think detection range on Twitch should get increased. You can't really ward for him when he jungles, and he'll just pop up on you, and he has interactions like this in lane that are quite unfair.
thanks for telling us
